author: hello3724
content: What would have happened if the bug in the code was on geth? How come 3 testnets didnt find it? Great job for the quick solution!

author: sky.cactus
content:
Can anyone here help me understand why this transaction is failing?
https://etherscan.io/tx/0xf367a95315d61f484306ca7e97f963bbf1ed181b86aa7932c92db72542917cce
It is trying to send some ETH to a forwarder contract which just does this on ETH receipt:
```
parentAddress.call.value(msg.value)(msg.data)
```
Looking at the VM Trace/Geth Trace/Parity Trace, the `CALL` opcode is using 12,687 gas according to vmTrace and `10187` gas according to Geth trace (`msg.data` is empty bytes), and also weird is that the callee is only receiving 3387 gas (even though there was way more than that available at the call site.

author: sky.cactus
content: Hmm, maybe an issue with the version of Solidity that built it... IIUC, it is pushing a hard-coded value onto the stack and subtracting that from the remaining gas and then passing the result to `CALL` for the `gas` parameter I believe.  Essentially, it seems to be trying to "reserve" some gas for after the call.

author: sky.cactus
content: And for reasons I don't fully understand, the amount of gas it is trying to reserve is pretty large (~35000).

author: ktl_xv
content: Able Tie#4048

author: protolambda
content: We don't like the idea of adding restrictions on who can join the server, or capcha stuff via DM etc. like some other servers do. As long as there's no spam in the server I think we just keep things as-is, and deal with the occasional spam in DMs :(.

author: protolambda
content: Discord has this option. It doesn't prevent bots. But maybe in the future we can add a simple entry-question (e.g. what is the name of the next eth1 hardfork) to filter out bots.

author: protolambda
content: We can give it a try though

author: protolambda
content: Will discuss with mods

author: timbeiko
content: FWIW I think as of now dealing with the small amount of spam isn't as bad as potentially turning away a potential contributor. Not a very strong opinion though.

author: trent_vanepps
content: answering a simple enough question is a pretty low bar

author: protolambda
content: We introduced this. If not accepting, bots can't DM others in the server. Hope that's strong enough. There's a small greyed-out option (in settings panel) to ask a short question to new users, Discord is working on the feature we need.
